summary.para: Retrieves the associated with the image frame.

param.name: cCount
param.para: The number of color contexts to retrieve.
This value must be the size of, or smaller than, the size available to ppIColorContexts.

param.name: ppIColorContexts
param.para: A pointer that receives a pointer to the objects.

param.name: pcActualCount
param.para: A pointer that receives the number of color contexts contained in the image frame.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: If NULL is passed for ppIColorContexts, and 0 is passed for cCount, this method will return the total number of color contexts in the image in pcActualCount.
The ppIColorContexts array must be filled with valid data: each in the array must have been created using .

member.name: IWICBitmapFrameDecode.GetMetadataQueryReader

summary.para: Retrieves a metadata query reader for the frame.

param.name: ppIMetadataQueryReader
param.para: When this method returns, contains a pointer to the frame's metadata query reader.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: For image formats with one frame (JPG, PNG, JPEG-XR), the frame-level query reader of the first frame is used to access all image metadata, and the decoder-level query reader isn’t used. For formats with more than one frame (GIF, TIFF), the frame-level query reader for a given frame is used to access metadata specific to that frame, and in the case of GIF a decoder-level metadata reader will be present. If the decoder doesn’t support metadata (BMP, ICO), this will return WINCODEC_ERR_UNSUPPORTEDOPERATION.

member.seealso: Overview of Reading and Writing Image Metadata

summary.para: Retrieves a small preview of the frame, if supported by the codec.

param.name: ppIThumbnail
param.para: A pointer that receives a pointer to the of the thumbnail.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Not all formats support thumbnails. Joint Photographic Experts Group (JPEG), Tagged Image File Format (TIFF), and Microsoft Windows Digital Photo (WDP) support thumbnails.
If the codec does not support thumbnails, return WINCODEC_ERROR_CODECNOTHUMBNAIL rather than E_NOTIMPL.

member.name: IWICBitmapFrameDecode

summary.para: Defines methods for decoding individual image frames of an encoded file.

member.seealso: How to Write a WIC-Enabled CODEC
